description: The ChatterBot system is structured around three core components: the `Storage Adapters`, `Training Module`, and `Corpus Data Loader`. The `Corpus Data Loader` is responsible for providing raw conversational data, which is then consumed by the `Training Module`. The `Training Module` processes this data to learn and update the chatbot's knowledge base, persisting and retrieving conversational statements through the `Storage Adapters`. This design ensures a clear separation of concerns, allowing for flexible data storage and diverse training methodologies.

components.name: Storage Adapters
components.description: Provides an abstract interface for all data persistence and retrieval operations within ChatterBot. It allows for interchangeable storage backends (e.g., SQL, NoSQL, in-memory) without affecting the core chatbot logic, managing the storage of statements, responses, and other conversational data.

components.name: Training Module
components.description: Responsible for the entire lifecycle of training the chatbot. It takes raw conversational data (corpus) and processes it to populate and update the chatbot's knowledge base, making it capable of generating responses.

components.name: Corpus Data Loader
components.description: Dedicated to loading and managing conversational corpus data. It provides a standardized way to access and prepare datasets that are used by the Training Module to train the chatbot, primarily through functions like `load_corpus` and `list_corpus_files`.

components.name: Unclassified
components.description: Component for all unclassified files and utility functions (Utility functions/External Libraries/Dependencies)
